review.title: Close to Union Square and transportation To Fisher

We felt the city could be cleaner and all the homeless people was not what you see in Florida. People we spoke to with children on vacation were nervous about some of the unstable people on the streets. We would not visit San Fransisco again.

review.title: A hotel with so much potential
review.reviewText:
This could be a great hotel. 
A good location, great price and decor is pleasing, and yet, the staff are unresponsive to complaints, the only lift is the slowest in the world (and have to share it with staff which stop at every floor) and the free WIFI is so slow at some points during the day its not worth using (if you offer it free as a benefit it needs to work at all times). 
I highlighted that the shower didn't work properly twice over the week. I got a note that the maintenance person had come and fixed the toilet! I reported this, the poor wifi and the maintenance note, it was apparently escalated to the manager, I then reported to the staff again two days later and never heard anything else.
review.positiveRemarks: A good location, great price and decor is fun and pleasing
review.negativeRemarks:
Responses and updates to complaints and issues. 
Better informed staff. 
Staff to use stairs during busy checkout/checkin times to reduce lift load.

review.title: Good Location, Noisy rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location 2-3 blocks from union square and it's flat so that's a plus for San Fran! A bit closer to the rougher part of SF that I was trying to avoid (tenderloin) as a single traveler but didn't have any problems other then some friendly conversations with a homeless man. I was given some information on arrival about transportation which was great though chose to walk most places as I like to get my bearings.The hotel was under some renovations at the time but everything was as advertised online i.e. the vertigo theme. My room was always cleaned to a high standard and the bathroom was in great condition. Only thing about the bathroom is it took me a while to figure out how to change the water flow from the bath tap to the shower tap. The room was spacious and the bed was super comfy. The only major downfalls where the slow elevator and the noise from other guests, I was in a corner room and when the people next door shut their door or even hopped into bed it sounded like it was in my own room and I even got scared at one point that someone was trying to open my door but it was just the people next door. Anyone walking down the hallway you could also hear very clearly.

Location
Cleanliness

review.title: Great concept and theme, outdated facilities
review.reviewText:
I recently stayed at this hotel for business purposes and thought it looked like a great hotel for the price. I have mixed reviews of the hotel. Overall, while it was a cute hotel, I definitely will not be staying here again. I wasn’t able to sleep while I was there, between the uncomfortable bed, loud cleaning staff in the hallways and the fact that I didn’t feel safe. In my opinion you’d be better off spending a few extra bucks to stay somewhere else.

If you are traveling for business – note that there is not a business center. They have a computer that is in the lobby so there is no privacy whatsoever. There is only one very rickety elevator that takes a lot of time. Some furniture and fixtures seemed outdated and some had visible wear and tear. The fitness center is under construction so I wasn’t able to use it. I didn’t know about this ahead of time so I was disappointed. The hotel cleaning staff was SO TERRIBLY LOUD in the morning that they woke me up daily. Not a lot of noise insulation. Bed was very uncomfortable.  Front desk staff was hit or miss – there was one gentleman who was okay, but the rest were not friendly or helpful. I arrived before regular check-in time, by 2 hours. I was told to come back, which almost never happens to me when I’m traveling for business. Obviously they have a right to do this, but it was the way they handled it that was not very pleasant, especially after a long flight.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel had a really cool Hitchcock theme throughout the lobby and rooms. Decent sized room. Comfy pillows. Free wi-fi. Good bathroom amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Safety! There are no internal locks on the doors and you're just a few blocks from a bad neighborhood. Not smart.
review.locationRemarks: There are many great restaurants within walking distance. A liquor store next door with lots of snacks (cheaper than snack bar).

review.title: Good value, nice hotel, borderline neighborhood
review.reviewText:
If you need to stay near Union Square and you need to pay less than the sky-high rates at some of the bigger hotels, this is a good option. The staff were friendly, the room was nice enough. There were some renovations going on but it didn't interfere with my stay. This was my second stay at Hotel Vertigo. I had a conference rate at a bigger hotel but they couldn't accomodate me for the first night of my stay, so I knew I needed another hotel for one night and I immediately thought of Hotel Vertigo.

The hotel is kind of on the edge between the Union Square neighborhood and the Tenderloin. It's not a really great area, but the hotel feels much nicer than its surroundings. 

I'm sure I'll stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great style, reasonable comfort.
review.locationRemarks: If you're ok with walking or taking a taxi/Uber, you're close enough to Union Square and the Fisherman's Wharf. Plenty to eat and to do.

review.title: Nice old hotel in old part of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice and clean close to all the downtown area. Would not mind recommending it to anyone
Great hotel! The service is awesome! Recommended!
Clean rooms, quite location in the middle of the city, comfortable beds, etc.

review.title: Fantastic staff, great location!!!!
review.reviewText: We stayed for two days at Hotel Vertigo and will stay here again in the future. The location is beyond great, just a 4 block walk to the trolley cars and plenty of buses to get you where you want to go. Parking is 49.00 per day at the hotel, we parked one block east of the hotel on Sutter and only paid $50.00 for two nights. The staff is the main reason we would go back. I asked the gentleman at the desk I think his name was Edward what sites we should see while in town. He provided us a detailed map of the area and pointed out what sites we could see on foot and what places we needed transportation. VERY HELPFUL, this guy should get a raise. My wife and I talked about him last night. Most employees don't go out of their way to help the way he did. This is a major reason we would go back, customer service, this place has it. No pool or Jacuzzi but that's ok. Plenty of places to eat in the area and my wife and I felt safe walking at night in he area. Great job Vertigo!!!!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Staff, rooms and the history if the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: No room for it but we love a Jacuzzi. That's ok though.

review.title: retro experience and decent location
review.reviewText: stayed while attending a convention at Moscone Center, retro and "Euro" style types will like this place, central located and there are good shops to eat and a grocery store 150 feet from the hotel on the same side of the street, fruit, milk, water and the necessary essentials (beer & wine) are available, there is a great rotisserie chicken place right next to the hotel too (surprisingly really good and cheap), overall this is on the border of "Knob Hill" and the "Tenderloin" district, however, I felt safe and witnessed nothing upsetting, would stay there again in a pinch, the only reason why I stayed here this time is due to the overbooked situation for the conference ...
review.positiveRemarks: location, retro style, staff was accommodating

review.title: Repeat customer, great location
review.reviewText:
I stay here for the amenities and location. Vertigo has what I need - clean, modern decor, a comfortable bed, a gym, nearby shops. Good value and  a $10 uber to most areas in the city. 

However, you have to be realistic about what you are paying and what you are getting. I've had a few glitches with the staff. And I've had to request refills of the coffee, etc after the maid has come. Oh, and the elevator is slow. But for around $200 a night in SF I'm ok with that.

Room tips: 3rd floor is great. High enough from the street to reduce noise but you have the option to take the stairs and avoid the slow elevator. I prefer courtyard facing for the quietness but my husband prefers the street view for the light.
The room was clean and the staff was very nice and helpful.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo: A Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: We had business to attend to in San Francisco and needed a conveniently located hotel. Hotel Vertigo definitely served that purpose. It was affordable and very close to locations we visited (Chinatown, Union Square, Business District, etc.). The surrounding neighborhood is obviously gentrifying - a lot of students living in the area - but it still has a lot of "intetesting" characters roaming around; though what major city anywhere in world doesn't. When you book make sure to keep in mind that valet parking at the hotel will cost you $45/day + $6 tax. Parking (and driving) in the city is challenging at best, but you may find cheaper overnight parking in one of several public parking garages located very near the hotel. Pro: The room was clean and well-equipped. Con: the bed was very uncomfortable. Two other pros: the hotel staff was nice and accommodating for sure, and the place is surrounded by small cafes for breakfast and lunch. We will stay again the next time we are in town; it's well priced for SF and again, convenient (for us). 3.75 stars.

review.title: Hotel with character in Lower Nobb Hill
review.reviewText: This is a lovely, small hotel located in the Lower Nobb Hill area. It was used in the Hitchcock movie Vertigo for exterior shots. The interior is cute and quirky. The staircase is a must see. The staff is friendly and efficient and also very caring. My first morning there I was in need of band aids and rather than telling me where to buy some, they rummaged around behind the desk and found me some. Saved my day! It is close to cable car lines and Union Square where the tour busses run. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys the smaller, more intimate hotel experience.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked everything about this hotel.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great value for what we got. The place was clean and well kept. There are two public buses nearby but the BART is around 8 blocks away. If you're coming from the BART and walking, beware that you will be walking uphill to the hotel (and most likely throughout your trip in San Francisco :)). The staff was friendly and had a small work out room with different machines. The workout room was quite loud, most likely due to keeping ventilation. The only big problem we had was that the housing staff broke our headphones when they were doing housekeeping. The process to replace them took a few days so we were missing headphones for a few days. Other than that, this hotel was a great value with well kept rooms in the heart of San Francisco.

The place was VERY clean (I hate seeing hair and whatnot from other people - none of that here). It was very quiet (they were at 50% vacancy when I stayed). The staff is the best. Very accommodating and helpful. The location is PERFECT. Within walking distance of shops, restaurants, Union Square. Loved it.

They offer  public parking close to hotel for 25$ till 1pm, and if you arrive at 5-7pm, you pay only 16$, it is cheaper than other parking places. The hotel is close to Union Squire (7minutes), Sears breakfast, China town. It is not Hilton or Intercontinental, but if you want to save money, it is good option, but try to avoid standard queen room.
review.locationRemarks: near to everything, walk distance.

review.title: Four blocks to the Regency ballroom
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel for it's proximity to the Regency and our New year's plans. Pleasant experience, would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, rates
review.negativeRemarks: It did seem like everything attached to the walls was in danger of coming down...the headboard, the towel racks, the shelf over the sink.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in city center

review.title: Funky!!!!
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly, boutique hotel. Centeral location. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: walking distance to union square.Clean and renevated
review.negativeRemarks: all good
review.locationRemarks: In walking distance of food, shopping and theater.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText:
Stayed at Vertigo for two nights while visiting our son in SF. We had a 'petite' room, which was big enough for the two of us. The bed was very comfortable, the room was very clean, the shower was excellent, and housekeeping was wonderful - they quickly brought me a replacement hair dryer for the tired and unusable one that was in the room. The room was super quiet, which I hadn't expected. There was no view (the wall of the building next door), but that didn't bother us because we weren't in SF to stay in the hotel and look out the window. I would rather have a quiet room than a view any day!
We didn't get the wake-up call that we requested, but we were told that it was because the phone was off the hook. We hadn't noticed that it was off the hook, but we got ourselves up on time, anyway. 
The location is great. I would definitely stay at the Vertigo again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, quiet and centrally located.

review.title: Smelly
review.reviewText: The room looks okay but it smell terrible. The key card ( or card reader) did not work well. I turned on the heater as it was quite cold in night and I saw lots of dust came out. Overall, I do not like it and I really do not understand why they got  good rating? Fake...

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: MY GIRLS AND I ENJOYED THE CENTRAL LOCATION TO UNION SQUARE, CABLE CARS THAT WENT TO FISHERMAN'S WHARF. GREAT RESTAURANTS AND CAFES WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE. WE LOVED TO WALK. FELT SAFE IN THIS AREA. THERE IS A FANTASTIC LITTLE FOOD SHOP TWO DOORS UP FROM HOTEL THEY DO GREAT CHICKEN/BEEF ROLLS WITH YUMMY FILLINGS AT GREAT PRICES AND OPEN LATE! THE
review.positiveRemarks: HOTEL WAS FUNKY AND PLEASING TO THE EYE, REALLY COMFY. NOT SURE ABOUT VALUE FOR MONEY BUT IT WAS PEAK SEASON (EARLY DEC).
review.negativeRemarks: OUR STAY WAS ONLY 4N AND ALL OUR REQUIREMENTS WERE MET. I ACTUALLY DON'T KNOW IF THE HOTEL HAD ANY DINING FACILITIES WE NEVER ENQUIRED.
review.locationRemarks: LOCATION AS PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED IS REALLY CENTRAL. WE LOVE WALKING AND IT'S CLOSE TO UNION SQUARE AND GREAT RESTAURANTS. CAN'T GO WRONG

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I had a great time here. It's very clean, still looks relatively new and the washrooms are very modern. Now since it is an older building the walls are paper thin, so it's very easy to hear your neighbors.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rooms, Modern washrooms and comfy beds.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel was only a 10 minute walk away from Union Square. Its great since you get to miss alot of the loud craziness at night.

review.title: Budget gem
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised with this nicely decorated budget hotel. Loved the theme and it was quite comfortable for the price. Within easy walking distance of many restaurants, coffee shops, shopping and cultural stops. Things did get a bit noisy but luckily everyone quieted down at a reasonable hour and then it was very quiet. Having the ability to make coffee and tea was a nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: Updated bath, large room, nice sized closet, tea/coffee and pot. Our room facing courtyard was quiet.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great plenty of coffee shops, restaurants, and shopping within walking distance.

review.title: Fantastic hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay at hotel vertigo. Highly recommend.

review.title: Decent hotel in grungy area
review.reviewText: Hotel Vertigo is a decent place to stay if you are in San Francisco for a quick business trip. However, it's not the greatest place to stay as a couple if you're looking for a bit of a romantic getaway. The hotel is located near Union Square, so it's expected that there is quite a variety of panhandlers in the area, we just didn't think there would be as many as there were. I wouldn't let my wife walk the streets around the hotel alone. The hotel staff was very helpful, they were the best part of our stay, responding quickly to our requests. We had to change rooms on our second night because there was a party going on in the room next to us, with about 20 people. The rooms look like they have had a recent "upgrade" but still feel dated without any charm (it's mostly the carpet). Overall, our stay was ok. I wouldn't necessarily recommend this hotel to friends, but would recommend it to business travellers looking to work with a budget.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great, very welcoming and attentive, and quick to respond.
review.negativeRemarks: Putting art or photography on the walls could make a huge difference to make the rooms and bathrooms feel more welcoming. Carpet isn't attractive.
review.locationRemarks: Coffee at Jane on Larkin or at Farm:Table is great. Union square's luxury streets are a clean escape from a lot of the grime on the other blocks.

review.title: Great hotel and staff
review.reviewText: Based on the other reviews, I thought that I would have a horrible experience. I read how the rooms can be very small and did not have much to offer. However, I had nothing but great experiences at Hotel Vertigo. The area where the hotel is located offers a lot of amenities from restaurants, bars, to cafe shops. The hotel is also very close to transportation and pharmacies. Overall, the hotel room is very modest, but comforting. We spent most of our stay (6 nights) exploring San Francisco and felt very relaxed after long days of walking.
review.positiveRemarks: The resourcefulness of the staff. If we needed any assistance with navigating the city, the hotel staff were very informative and attentive
review.negativeRemarks: I think the bedding is in need of an upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Can visit the tourist areas, such as Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz. I enjoyed visiting Chinatown, Union Square, and Mission Street for Texan flare.

review.title: Great hotel great price !
review.reviewText: The only reason this hotel won't get 5 stars for me is because it did not have a restaurant, room service, or a bar. Which would have been nice, but their is a bunch of local bars and restaurants. Also the rooms are a bit small, but for the price it is reasonable. Very clean and nice modern decor. Their isn't ac, but you honestly don't need it. Very easy to get transportation to the airport and easy to catch a taxi. You can literally walk to union square in about 8-10min. I was very pleased with my stay.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I selected the hotel based on the expedia rating, location (a 15 minute walk from my conference hotel) and room rate. The hotel lived up to my expectations and the front desk staff exceeded it in helpfulness and friendliness.
review.positiveRemarks: The room size, the cleanliness, the staff, the location.

review.title: Business trip to SF
review.reviewText: The Hotel Vertigo is a good hotel that wants to be a hip hotel and if the had an F & B component they could be. It looks like they started to but a Lobby bar in about a year ago but never finished the project and they have temp construction wall up also they seem to have closed the meeting space down on the mezzanine level and put up another temp wall. The lobby other that these two temp walls is beautiful but empty.... With out the F & B (lobby bar) they have no reason to have a social lobby and it will not be that hip hotel it should be. Staff is great my TV didn't work for two days (thank you Direct TV). The hotel discounted my rate.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is great and friendly.... Room was nice other than the horsehead table lamps.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs an F & B component Lobby bar for a social lobby or gathering place. Needs meeting space. The shower heads suck give me a regular shower head.

review.title: Cool boutique hotel.
review.reviewText: Old building, cool decor, nice staff.  Really good location to catch cable car or hit Nob Hill.  Room was clean and comfortable. .a little small, but super cool.
The hotel is nicely renovated. No A/C but they have a ceiling fan. The room is small but fits a single person perfectly.

review.title: Great hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Very pleased to find a hotel with character, excellent value for money and very good facilities.  Did not expect the white fluffy dressing gowns for the price paid but they were provided. No bar, breakfast or restaurant but lots of good options close by.

review.title: Awesome location
review.reviewText: Beautiful old hotel with awesome history centered in the heart of the tenderloin .. We will definetly be back!!!
Very accommodating.  Stored our luggage and parked our car so we could get to the World Series game.  Great customer service.
Change the double beds in queens bed. There is space for it !!

review.title: historic yet new
review.reviewText: A great location close to everything. The room was very modern and clean. Tues there is no air condition (it's a very old hotel what do you expect) ... But then again the Bay Area is not that hot. My partner and I were fine with the celing fan, wall fan, and nice big window the cool air was flowing in (we were on the 7th floor) ... Free wine also and the valet was great.... Keep in mind you must park in front of the hotel 1st and ask for the valet ... Wonderful fun clean hotel

review.title: Convenient, Clean and Central
review.reviewText:
This hotel is comfortable, clean and convenient for central San Francisco. We stayed in mid October so the room was a pleasant temperature with the cooling ceiling fan running through the night. It might get hot in the summer, though. The staff are very helpful and friendly. 
We had hearty breakfasts across the street at Thad's Cosy Cafe, another friendly establishment.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: It was a good experience.  Nice hotel close to Union Square.

review.title: not great...not terrible
review.reviewText: located in a transitional neighborhood, it is walkable to most SF spots.  No frills and no air conditioning so stay away during mid-summer.
Easy walk to union square and cable cars. The hotel was nice enough but the bed we had was uncomfortable. We sstayed only a weekend any longer and we would have had to change hotels.

review.title: great staff, location and hotel
review.reviewText: the staff is friendly, helpful and extremely great all around. from the receptionist to the maintenance man.really great staff. the hotel is located half a mile away from union square nice 5 minute walk. there are a lot of great places to eat or get a drink along the way. the room its self is nice well furnished nice decor. could use a bigger tv but we really didn't use it.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff's courtesy and professionalism, along with their knowledge of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing really. maybe long hours for the coffee
review.locationRemarks: for a quick bite there's boar head next door. they have great cold cuts. if you want to get a drink there's the white horse down the street.

review.title: Old building, No Air Conditioning!
review.reviewText: The room did not have any air conditioning. The hotel placed a large very loud fan in the room to attempt to cool it, but it was so noisy leaving it on made it impossible to sleep. It's either too hot with the fan off or too loud with the fan on. It was not a pleasant night!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need Air Conditioning units!
review.locationRemarks: Good breakfast coffee shops located close by.

review.title: Great stylish hotel
review.reviewText: Great friendly staff, great ubication around 8-10 minutes walking distance from heart of union square, free tea and coffee in the morning and free wine from 5:30-6:30pm

review.title: good enough for overnight stay
review.reviewText:
no A/C, it was a surprise.
cable was not no working.
review.negativeRemarks: to install A/C

review.reviewText: Very pleasant staff, ideal location and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Air Circulation, stay on a lower floor on hot days
review.locationRemarks: Everything in walking distance

review.title: Old building in good condition, nice neighbourhood
review.reviewText: We had a room on the back of the Hotel , ofcourse you hear the sounds of the firetrucks etc in the room , but I didn't miss any sleep over it. Easy walk from the california cable car.
review.positiveRemarks: The location
review.negativeRemarks: I could use a Airconditioning in the room.

review.title: Short walk from BART Powell street
review.reviewText: Great hotel and brilliant staff. Really helpful with plenty of decent suggestions for local area. quick, free wifi.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff. Friendly and helpful. Great location. Found my way around town and came back to nice clean room.

review.title: Nice hotel within walking distance to Union Square
review.reviewText: A comfortable, practical place to stay, close to Union Square, but with the advantage of peace and quiet, and proximity to good restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Same as above.

review.title: Boutique but....
review.reviewText: Definitely a boutique hotel look and feel but really missing some key things. Overall decor and cleanliness is just fine -- funky modern updates to a cool old building.  Do note however that there's no AC -- fine on most days but definitely something to note as there are also no screens on the window so you get the additional company of some bugs!  Its August so I didn't test the heat but there's no thermostat so you'll have no control of the temperature any time of year.  Also there's no TV to speak of -- fuzzy picture for about three rather obscure channels.  Granted in a city as fun as SF TV isn't a huge priority but still not what you would expect.  It as a busy time in SF and I paid over $400/night so a disappointing experience overall.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Clarity about the amenities NOT available would help -- temperature control and TV service are basic expectations.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location to various services. Good and helpful service.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Close to union square, friendly staff and overall awesome experience

review.title: Centrally located for touring round
review.reviewText: Spent 2 enjoyable nights in San Fran. Hotel Vertigo is ideally located with helpful and friendly staff who gave good honest advice.

review.title: Too much hype
review.reviewText: They def hype the website description up to make up for the over priced rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Relatively large and up to date rooms.  Two classic San Francisco interior staircases plus elevator. Decent breakfast places nearby.

review.title: San Francisco Getaway
review.reviewText: This was my husband's first trip to San Francisco. I choose the Vertigo for the location. I was a bit hesitant due to some of the reviews. Boy was I surprised. The hotel is great. The rooms, yes they are small, but they are clean, well maintained and cozy. There is coffee in the room, a mini refrigerator, very nice shampoo and conditioner. The wine reception in the evening is a plus. We met a couple here from London. It was nice to come back the next day and share out adventures.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, very well maintained. Very helpful and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: More information on how the parking works. Let people know it is off site. And it's okay to double park while you check.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of local places to eat. You can walk to China town, Union Square. A few blocks away you can get on the cable cars.

review.title: Near the cable cars to hop on.
review.reviewText: A little pricy, but you are paying for the honor of staying at a classic movie "prop"......Parking has to be valet, as there are no parking spots on the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Location
review.negativeRemarks: Unusual to need AC in San Fran, but we did need it and they didn't really have it.

review.title: Eh
review.reviewText:
The hotel was relatively close to most areas you would want to visit and the public transportation options worked well. However, the hotel itself wasn't that great.  The plumbing didn't work at all in the first room we had.  When we called down to alert them, they just moved us to another room.  The plumbing in the other room did work, but sometimes did require a second flush. 

The front desk staff isn't really that helpful.  They do give directions but are not very clear about which specifics.

Also, when we checked out, the front desk seemed to be preoccupied and didn't really pay any attention to what we were asking upon checking out.  

This hotel is very expensive, and not worth the price.  I'm still waiting for a $75 "incidental" fee to be reimbursed to my card when I was told it would only take 1 day.  There is no A/C, no frill, and no personal touches.  I would only stay here again if the rates were GREATLY reduced.

review.title: The Place To Be In San Francisco
review.reviewText: Had a great time at the Vertigo. Great staff. So Friendly and Helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is excellent.
review.locationRemarks: Have to go to AT&T BallPark for Giants games. Go see the Golden Gate Bridge. Fisherman's Wharf. Pier 39. Alcatraz.

review.title: Convenient location, no objections for price
review.reviewText: The hotel is comfortable and convenient--cheaper parking fee helps.

review.title: Good hotel for first visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located in a nice quiet street with shops and restaurants. The hotel does state it has valet parking although the reception staff will advise you to use the local public car park instead because it is cheaper.
Union Square and the cable car were very close by. Although the hotel was clean, the room was comfortable and modern, the reception staff were not particularly friendly. Unfortunately it was not just one person but all that reception staff that we had encountered. Luckily we only needed to talk to them a few times so it did not have a massive impact upon our stay and if this was not the case the hotel would be rated 5 across the board.
review.positiveRemarks: The Location and decor was great. The hotel room and communal areas were very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The friendliness and helpfulness of the reception staff could be improved.
review.locationRemarks: It was in very close walking distance to Union Square the the cable car stops.

review.title: what we wanted
review.reviewText: Front desk was very helpful explaining transportation around the city. got the best room for us. friendly and clean
review.positiveRemarks: front desk help
review.negativeRemarks: fine
review.locationRemarks: fair price for location

review.title: Quirky and convenient
review.reviewText:
Hotel Vertigo was great - it's in walking distance to Union Square, and if you're game you can walk up Nob Hill towards Fisherman's Wharf right from the hotel, complete with views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. Up Hyde St in particular there are lots of great restaurants and cafés.

My room was petite, but clean and very comfortable. It's quirky enough to fit in with its history and feels like a bit of a time capsule, in a good way! The staff were helpful but not pushy, and as a woman staying by myself I always felt welcomed and safe. I would thoroughly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, location and comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: You could hear passing traffic and sirens - although the hotel is right in the city, so it's not that surprising.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Union Square and go shopping or catch a bus to City Hall, Fisherman's Wharf or Haight-Ashbury, or up Hyde St to the Wharf and Russian Hill.

review.title: Basic hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel is ok. The rooms are clean and well designed with comfy beds. The hotel needs to either remove the tv or pay to get more than 4 obscure channels with no local / news option.

Of all the staff I interacted with only one (bearded gentleman who was outstanding) seemed to care to be helpful and friendly. I felt like I was disturbing the rest.

The location is ok if you know sf well enough to understand that the street people and crack dealers down the street are usually harmless.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent. The room was comfortable and I no issues during my stay.

review.title: What more could you ask for?
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in an acceptable neighborhood and is centrally located.  I happened to arrive at the Ferry Building/Embarcadero and took a bus with friends to the the hotel. It was a short walk between the bus stop and the hotel and I would have been fine walking it alone day or night. Since it's prior existence as the York, this hotel has become a fun boutique hotel with crisp white, orange and brown decor.
review.positiveRemarks: I was VERY surprised to see how spacious my tiny room was and it was outfitted with all of the usual stuff including a hair dryer and nice bathroom to
review.negativeRemarks: The only negative are: 1) the crank windows opened fine which made the temperature controllable without a/c - but there are no screens to it feels a l
review.locationRemarks: I had to go to an event at the Regency which is on Sutter/Van Ness.  The hotel was a perfect 7 minute walk.

review.title: Big city price, just ok.
review.reviewText: Location was good and the hotel was newly painted and very clean. The Hitchcock vibe was cute. A few steps away you could find pizza and on the corner a nice coffee house for the morning fix. I stayed during a May heat wave with no AC, only a small ceiling fan. May want to consider that during the summer. Short walk to the cable cars. Parking will set you back. I arrived from the airport on the Metro and it was an uphill walk that I enjoyed, but take a taxi if street people stress you.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, with a good location. Complementary wine, nice lobby, pleasant staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs air conditioning for the hot days, big gap under door let in light and noise. Bed could be better.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to city center. The corner cafe for scones and coffee in the morning and a pint in the afternoon.

review.title: Great stay - residential neighbourhood though
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine - a bit pricey at 159 a night in that area. Lots of places to eat if u walk to Polk and post area. Fav drinking spot is Aces on the corner and the fly for food. Cheap beer and applies at One Eleven. Hotel elevators very slow, mini bar prices not bad, room very small - bathroom was nearly as big as the room. Walking distance to a lot of things but lots of street people and homelessness which we have never openly seen before. Cheap drinks and food in the store by Aces - in fact took a cab there to replenish our stock once we moved to another hotel in Union square. Safe to walk around though - not bad of a place over all. Cute lobby and rooms as pictured.

review.title: Comfortable Affordable SF hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Vertigo was the only hotel I could find near Union Square or the Financial District that looked decent and didn't cost way north of $300. With tax, just over $300. It is an older building but clean and eclectically designed. Per the name, the James Stewart movie is playing in the lobby. The Cal King bed was comfortable, the room roomie and the bathroom nice. The carpet could have been better. The orange leather covered wing chair with VERTIGO embroidered vertically on the seat was unusual. The downside is the hotel doesn't have a restaurant or bar but the neighborhood has lots of options within a short walk. I ate at the Nob Hill Grille and loved it.
review.positiveRemarks: It's character
review.negativeRemarks: room service
review.locationRemarks: On Nob Hill above Union Square. Pretty centrally located to get around The City. Several eateries around, Walgreens, liquor store nearby.

review.title: Quirky but small - very small rooms
review.reviewText: The location was ok but bordered on a sketchy part of town. The hotel rooms were very small but had comfortable beds. Although there was a nice TV, there were surprisingly few TV channels available. Some of the staff not really warm and welcoming. Parking was an issue - find your own or pay $40 per day to have them park the car. Even unloading at front door a bit of an issue. We did try to book another night but were told we needed to do it on-line!
review.positiveRemarks: The quirky lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: See comments above. Fairly pricey for what you got.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is so compact you can pretty much walk everywhere or catch street/cable cars nearby.

review.title: I didn't like it
review.reviewText: Unwelcoming staff and not quite good for the price. It should be 30% cheaper

review.title: A fair price in downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Would highly recommend this hotel. Newly refurbished, clean, and well appointed. A treasure within the city by the bay!

review.title: Overnight in the city with friends.
review.reviewText: The morning was pretty awful. Really loud vacuuming early in the morning, knocks on the door. No point in a noon check out since you want to leave because of the noise.

review.title: Ideal location in central San Francisco
review.reviewText: Stayed 4 nights at Hotel Vertigo and overall pleased. Yes it is basic and the interior is old however it is clean and tidy and the staff were helpful. Located within walking distance of china town and union square and there are a number of cool little bars nearby so made it a decent little spot to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Nice hotel downtown
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this quaint hotel that took me back to the sixties. So retro and cool. Great location. The bathroom and shower was awesome.

review.title: Nice, Clean, Comfortable, Quiet, Characterful
review.reviewText:
As above, I was really pleased with this hotel as it was clean, comfortable, quiet, characterful and in a great location. No issues with walking home at night from Bart stations (about 15 mins walk) as long as you didn't go through Tenderloin.

Loads of nice, cool cafes and bars close by serving good food and breakfasts etc. Also lots of Academy of Arts Institute buildings around which means plenty of harmless students around at most times of the day and night.

Cool place, glad I picked it, I would recommend and would stay here again. (I'd also check out The Mosser which I think is owned by the same people and is in an even more central location).

Wifi worked pretty well too - was able to manage Skype video calls.
review.positiveRemarks: It's character. Had plenty of character, like an older independent hotel but at the same time was very clean, quiet and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Could have better coffee and a small breakfast would be great. Although plenty of nice places nearby,

review.title: Nice and handy urban hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is well located within minutes from amenities and local transport. Would be great if it had a bar. Shower is huge, rooms fairly comfortable. Shame it does not serve breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Room size, bathroom amenities and decoration of the lobby and bedrooms
review.negativeRemarks: The TV only have few channels, a bar and breakfast would be great
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of bars, shops, restaurants and thing to do

review.title: Clean modern hotel, good location, close to town
review.reviewText: Lovely modern room. A bit small but still managed to fit a cot (crib according to the to Americans). A short walk to Union Square, slight downhill (uphill back home). A few nice places to eat out nearby. Staff were very helpful and friendly, knowledgeable and very willing to give advice.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything you need
review.reviewText: Excellent experience, clean, roomy, nice staff. Decor is awesome and walking distance to many tourist attractions or a cable ride away. very affordable.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, price, size, decor, location, staff
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees! 35 a night
review.locationRemarks: Great food, bars, walking distance to Chinatown, Financial District and a cable car ride away from the rest.

review.title: Destination for Hitchcock fans
review.reviewText: it's a place for the fans, not recommended for general population.
review.positiveRemarks: the Hitchcock vibe, the staircase.
review.locationRemarks: on sutter st, close to union square

review.title: Good location, loud rooms
review.reviewText: The walls are very thin and you can hear your neighbors. The double rooms are a little small but all in all a nice experience.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: I was supposed to move into my dorm, but they wouldn't let me stay because of some paperwork they goofed on. So I found this place, literally a minute away. It was super comfortable and less than 100$. They even gave me a toothbrush cause I forgot to pack one.

review.title: A fine San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the lobby with its fresh white paint and statuary. Staff was very welcoming. The room was nice enough and the bed SO-O-O COMFY. We want to know where they got their pillows. Not much hanging space in the closet but who cares. The location was perfect for us, four easy blocks to Van Ness where our event was held, a great location generally. I loved looking down the stairwell and suddenly remembering the cheesy falling-to-death scenes in Vertigo, though I don't think any happened in that stairwell, don't remember. No matter. No one fell down the stairwell while we were there either. Good place, recommended.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very clean yet also an older place, as I prefer.
review.negativeRemarks: The closet was largely taken up by a huge safe. Maybe that works for some people.
review.locationRemarks: our blocks from Van Ness, three from Polk, you can't go wrong here.

review.title: VERY NICE EXPERIENCE
review.reviewText: EVERYTHING WAS GREAT
review.positiveRemarks: VERY ATTRACTIVE, COMFORTABLE AND CLEAN ROOM. STAFF VERY NICE.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel has very cute, modern décor. The room was a bit small, but that's to be expected in the city. The bed was a murphy bed folded down from the wall so it was a bit uncomfortable and not very sturdy, but not too bad. Other than that, the bathrooms were very nice with newer, modern fixtures. The staff was friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The valet service was convenient.
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Right in the middle of everything and just a few blocks from union square.

review.title: Great hotel, safe neighborhood
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly, hotel was clean and beautiful, room was well equipped, and the neighbourhood felt safe. Transportation and shopping were close, and many restaurants were within walking distance. Staff were very helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Whirlwind tour of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Came on an unexpected trip to San Francisco and to spend a little "me" time away from the family. The hotel provides a tea/coffee machine, snacks and a variety of sweets and drinks in a fridge for use, all reasonably priced. The rooms all have the usual tv and also have a clock/radio docking pad for the ipod. It has a nice meeting area laid out where tea and coffee are freely served in the mornings and there is a nice wine hour in the evenings where guests can meet and unwind from the day.
review.positiveRemarks: It was fresh and clean looking with really friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: The location is a few blocks away from the Cable Cars on Hyde Street and closer to the shopping in Union Square

review.title: Quirky inner city hotel
review.reviewText: Found the Vertigo Hotel to be exactly as advertised. The hotel is very quirky and themed around Alfred Hitchcock's movie Vertigo. The hotel is a little older however it has recently been modernised with fresh paint, carpets, curtains etc. Our room was large, had a very comfortable queen size bed & pillows. The bathroom was small but was clean and fully functional. We didn't know much about the area, the hotel is near Nob Hill and Union Square and about a 10-15 min walk to the main shopping areas. The main tram line which goes to Fishermans Wharf is also about a 10 min walk away. They don't serve food however the surrounding area has a number of cafes which all do reasonable breakfasts, lunches etc. There are also a number of restaurants in the area. Overall we would recommend as a reasonably priced hotel in a fairly central location.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor - nice to see something different from the usual "beige" hotels. The beds were also super comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the hotel works well within its current constraints. Having only 1 lift did mean we had to wait a bit sometimes to get up to our room.
review.locationRemarks: There isn't a lot to do in the surrounding area so you need to be prepared to walk around and also catch the trams/buses or taxi's etc.

review.title: Holiday in San Francisco
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a beautiful city. We had a marvellous holiday and did lots of interesting things. It's a pity that something is not done though, about the beggars and the homeless in such an affluent city and country. However, it was our second visit and we will probably visit again.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Especially its connection to the iconic film Vertigo.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be good if there was a breakfast facility.
review.locationRemarks: Too numerous to mention!

review.title: Best by far
review.reviewText:
This hotel was one of the best hotels we stayed at in America. Staff we the most friendly and most helpful to us at all times.

Very central to sites and activities that we were interested in.

review.title: Not a place you want to consider
review.reviewText:
We checked in around 1 pm
Bed sheets has spots of things I won't explain. So called "fresh sheets " were brought in and guess what-stains again.
Luckily, my wife brought bed sheets from home(just in case)
We were very uncomfortable the whole time we used anything in the room.
I have been traveling for the last 30 years, never came across anything like this before
Filthy bed sheets ..wow
In this day and internet age.

review.title: our second stay
review.reviewText:
this is the second time in two weeks we have stayed at the hotel. Clean, well situated, staff helpful.
Really good experience.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo, San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I was on a business trip to San Francisco for 4 days and thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Vertigo. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Although the decor of the rooms was a bit dated, they were very comfortable and it was great to have a desk to work on. The bathroom was modern, spotless and well equipped.
I would definitely consider staying there again if in SF.

review.title: A disappointment
review.reviewText: I was really excited about this hotel because of its connection to the film and its beautiful photos online. In reality, although the lobby loos nice, the hotel itself is quite sad and rundown. The front desk staff were mostly unpleasant (never greeting anyone with a hello, and responding with confusion and irritation at questions) and appearing unhappy to work there, and we had a room with a broken shower that was not fixed even after we complained. Add to that a room safe that did not work properly, moths in the room, and an unstocked coffee maker - it was a highly disappointing experience, and I would NEVER go back.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is striking.
review.negativeRemarks: Share more regarding the hotel's connection to the film. Respond to maintenance requests. Stock in-room coffee makers. Smile and be helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The surrounding neighborhood is inconsistent, but if you don't mind walking, Union Square is quite close.

review.title: Central and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great location for walking to all locations. Clean and modern, nice room, happy and helpful staff. We will use again.

review.title: nice place, good location
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Hotel is in a very central location.
review.negativeRemarks: if they actually had a valet guy , that would have been nice.

review.title: Awesome beds, decent location
review.reviewText: Beds are comfy. $35+ 15% tax = close to $40 per day to park. Only complaint, the hotel was good other than this.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds, locAtion
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fees, minibar selection.
review.locationRemarks: Great cheap eats at "The Fly"

review.title: hotel vertigo san francisco
review.reviewText: Well situated, very helpful reception staff, especially Greg and Carl.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Welcoming staff, fun guy on desk during day. Helpful advice for getting around San Fran.

Comfortable beds, Plenty of room
review.positiveRemarks: Good Location, Value for money.
review.negativeRemarks: No tea bags in room
review.locationRemarks: 10 minute walk from centre of San Fran

review.title: Hotel with personality!
review.reviewText:
A great hotel with lots of character. It's in a fantastic location ( Safe area) and we walked almost everywhere.
I found it was a little overpriced- there was no air conditioning and some facilities were a little outdated.
But overall, a good stay- i'd return again in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Quirky decor and great location
review.negativeRemarks: No air conditioning, and some facilities were a little run down for the price

review.title: modern Hotel near union square
review.reviewText: Great hotel, good location, 10 minutes to union square and on a safe street. Close to cable car stops at union square and the other direction takes you to a main. Bus route as well, to the Golden Gate Bridge etc. Very clean room with good quality bedding etc. No hotel bar but go to the Hotel Rex library bar on the same street towards Union st. great atmosphere there. Friendly, helpful staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality and cleanliness of bedding, room and bathroom. Quirky modern decoration
review.negativeRemarks: No air conditioning, just a fan, but not actually a problem for me as the room was cool enough even though it was hot outside.
review.locationRemarks: located near main shopping area. A cable car ride is a must!! Very thrilling and the car drivers are very entertaining!

review.title: funky hotel in great location
review.reviewText:
Stylish hotel in a great location for Union square, and only half an hour to Fishersman Wharf via Chinatown or Nob Hill. Clean room, some muffins with breakfast coffee would make a nice touch.
Only let down were the grumpy female staff at the front desk - its not too much to expect someone to look at you when they're talking!
review.positiveRemarks: styling, colours and Vertigo theme
review.negativeRemarks: grumpy staff
review.locationRemarks: ideal for union square

review.title: I had an excellent stay in this hotel. I love it.
review.reviewText: The staff was very courteous and polite. Staff offers help and assistance with a BIG SMILE. The HOTELS IS SUPER CLEAN AND NEAT. I like the Spanish Architecture. Apparently, this Hotel was the filming of "Vertigo".
review.positiveRemarks: Clean Staff Architecture Brillant Color
review.negativeRemarks: Provide breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty in SF. Just by walking the street you will enjoy it. If you like working out the street itself will make you work out because of several domes

review.title: Small hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
This is a smallish hotel, artsy-bohemian decor. Clean. Great location for Union Square conventions, because it is a few blocks removed from the bustle, and slightly up Nob Hill, so a nicer street scene than Geary, Eddy etc.
Free coffee in the morning, wine hour in the afternoon, small but nice gym.

review.title: It's just OK overpriced
review.reviewText: The carpet was wet, NO AC and it was hot and the windows don't open. Bathroom very small. In prime location though but to expensive for what you get. Hotel looks old and run down with just cosmetic renovations making it look great in pictures.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great value for San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The location and price of this hotel is an amazing find for San Francisco! The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and the room was very clean, secure and comfortable. Complimentary wine was offered in the lobby from 5pm onwards during the week, which I thought was very nice; to sit in the lobby with a newspaper and have a glass of red while kicking your feet up after a day of playing tourist! The location was incredible! On Sutter Street, it was far enough away from the hustle-bustle of Union Square, yet accessible to it for shopping and getting to/from the BART station. It was close to many of the must-see tourist destinations (Pier 39, China Town, Lombard Street, Powell Street etc). It was a great location for a walk-about with so many fantastic views of the city! I would stay here again and I would recommend this charming little boutique hotel to a friend.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hitchcock theme was unique and charming!
review.locationRemarks: Ideal

review.title: Great value in a great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great value. It was convenient to everything without being in a touristy area. Staff was helpful. Rooms were nice and the beds very comfortable. The only negatives in my book are the thin walls, no feather pillows, and lack of room service. I generally stay in 5 star hotels so this was a bit of a departure for me. I was leery of taking the chance but the cost was unbeatable. I'm glad I took the chance because this was a nice hotel in a good area and lived up to its billing in the positive reviews.
review.positiveRemarks: Value, location, cool decor
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls, no room service, no feather pillows
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to everything but not touristy

review.title: Complete disappointment
review.reviewText:
We arrived about an hour and a half before check in at 3 p.m. and were told that we could check in as soon as there was a room ready. We went out to lunch and came back at 2:45 but still could not check in. It was 3:25 before a room was ready and then I had to call back to the front dest to let them know that there was a huge wet blue stain on the bed's comforter that smelled like bleach.
The hotel advertises two cordless phones in each room. What it doesn't say is that neither handset works. I had to talk on the speaker phone in order to call the front desk. Also the carpet going into the bathroom was soaking wet and remained wet the entire two days we stayed there. I reported it to the front desk along with the non working phone but nothing was done.
The room was hot and there was no air conditioner only a ceiling fan and the windows were permanently sealed shut. There was only one electrical outlet in the bathroom and it did not work. I had to blow dry my hair in the bedroom without a mirror.
The web site also advertises a refrigerator in every room. There was a cabinet that looked like a refrigerator but no real refrigerator.
review.positiveRemarks: The wed site made it look intriguing but nothing could be further from the truth.
review.negativeRemarks: No air conditioning.....no working outlet in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of many attractions.

review.title: All you need from a hotel
review.reviewText: Well situated, stylish/spacious rooms and all the mod cons. What more do you need.

review.title: Staff attitude
review.reviewText: The hotel is very quirky and is comfortable. The front desk staff that we experienced did not have the nicest attitude on them. When we would past the front desk they would not really look up to acknowledge you at all. The rooms are clean and the facilities are clean also
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms had great decor
review.negativeRemarks: Staff attitude
review.locationRemarks: Great location in San Fran

review.title: An enjoyable stay.
review.reviewText: Nothing fancy, but quite adequate. The location was convenient but our room was very quiet, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and most importantly the room was clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, friendly staff, well kept.

review.title: Good service, location
review.reviewText: Cute, neat boutique hotel with a bit of history (it was in the Hitchcock film Vertigo). Centrally located between the Fisherman's Warf area and the city's major music venues. This was my second stay and the staff has always been friendly, helpful and courteous. Groceries and good coffee shop breakfast, lunch places nearby. I will stay there again.

review.title: Good location - easy access to many things
review.reviewText: Room was small - bath room was very small. Room was clean. Hotel staff were very nice and helpful with restaurant suggestions.
review.negativeRemarks: no parking - no restaurant on site - no place to put anything in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: in the arts districtrict - interesting location

review.title: Great hotel with lots of novelty
review.reviewText: The hotel is fantastic suiting us perfectly. The location is great and the staff very nice. We loved the decor and general presentation.

review.title: Our Vertigo experience
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this boutique hotel. We had a room at the back so we didn't hear the street noise. Our beds were very comfortable and we enjoyed the walk-in closet and renovated bathroom. The walls could use more soundproofing though. We appreciated the tea and coffee provided in the morning in the lobby and free use of a computer and printer. The staff was very helpful with any questions we had. For breakfast we went to a quaint little Café across the street with fuchsia walls, friendly owners and good food!

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: I have just spent 3 wonderful days in San Francisco and the staff at vertigo were brilliant they were helpful with all travel arrangements and recommendations thank you
review.positiveRemarks: Great friendly stand
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee downstairs
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic easy to get and within walking distance to union square Chinatown and lots of other attractions

review.title: Fell well short of expectations
review.reviewText: On arrival there was only one employee on duty-noone was available to help with bags. I was told valet required at least 30 minutes notice to retrieve my vehicle. Mobile phone reception was impossible in my room. The in-house phones are most unusual and impossible to work.
review.positiveRemarks: Name
review.negativeRemarks: Most things.
review.locationRemarks: Location is close to a seedy area-local friends advised strong caution if walking in the area after dark.

review.title: "DIsoriented, Stay here''
review.reviewText:
The elevator, the only elevator, was sometimes slow. But the stairway was quick. No cups in bathroom. The glass cups to be used in conjunction with the ice bucket were not replaced when used for drinking glasses in the bathroom, both were taken from the bathroom and not replaced. Stayed four nights Feb. 27-March 3.

Front desk personnel very helpful regardless of shift change. Would stay again. Restaurants, cafes and deli choices within easy walking distance. Hitchcock theme and Vertigo movie constantly playing on lobby flat-screen a unique twist.

Good job Vertigo!

review.title: Charming with a twist...
review.reviewText:
Very cool hotel. The room was decorated well and included all the must haves. Fridge, safe, two cordless phones, iPod dock... great flat screen TV (although the reception and channel choices weren't great) The neighborhood is safe and filled with great coffee shops, bars and non-chain type restaurants.

Love that they have a 24/7 loop of Hitchcock's Vertigo showing in the lobby at all times (kinda wish it was available in the guest rooms so we could watch the whole thing!)

Great little boutique place; I can't wait to visit again!
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the Vertigo staircase in the center of the hotel
review.negativeRemarks: Television service
review.locationRemarks: quaint, safe, pretty quiet for the city... easy to get around and to catch a cab. ust a couple of blocks to Union Square and easy to walk.

review.title: solid hotel
review.reviewText: very solid hotel, would stay here again. Not luxurious, but quite comfortable and a good location.

review.title: Worked out just fine
review.reviewText: Mostly a positive experience. Good location. Staff was very helpful. The in-room phone was erratic. The rooms average size, but comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location and convenient to all the downtown activities.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText:
Cell Phone coverage in rear of hotel is abysmal, I could not get a signal any where in my room. Worked fine in lobby.

WiFi signal was strong but the internet access was spotty, some times it was super fast and stable, other times it dropped every few minutes.

Room was nice, television awesome.

Night staff was great, morning teams a little surly.

Window was not sealed well, so outside noise was like I was outside. Not bad for traffic as my room was in the back of the hotel, but there was a constant drip-drip that sounded like it was on my head.
review.positiveRemarks: TV
review.negativeRemarks: Cell Coverage
review.locationRemarks: Great Location, lots of shops around and 5 mins from Union Square.

review.title: clean n value for ur money.

Most imp very clean hotel..decent street so that u can walk till late too.
Friendly staff , always smiling.ready to help..I loved staying at this place.
Value for money...this is what we look for , isn't ?
review.positiveRemarks: White n orange color combo gives u a fresh feeling.
review.negativeRemarks: U have to walk to get bus..but a small walk.
review.locationRemarks: Decent street, near to all POI.

review.title: Good for the price you pay
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed at Hotel Vertigo for 4 nights while we were in San Francisco for vacation. The hotel is located approximately a 20 minute walk from Union Square (so not really that close if you're looking to be super close to all the action). The hotel itself looks like an old apartment that has been converted into a hotel. The decor of the hotel is quite modern, but if you look closely, there is a bit of run-down feel to it (i.e. a bit of peeling in the bath tub, the sinks don't drain that quickly, walls have a bit of peeling), but overall, for the price you pay, it is not bad. The beds are decent and comfortable, so i cant complain.

The staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful with tips of what to do in the city and how to get around with local buses and subway since we wanted to avoid the hefty cab bills that could add up quickly. There is no breakfast at the hotel, but they do put out some coffee and teas in the morning which is nice. There are some cafes where you could have breakfast nearby so its not a big deal.
review.positiveRemarks:
Relatively cheap price
Friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks:
A bit run down in our room
No breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Location is walkable to Union Square and close to some MUNI bus lines

review.title: Great Hotel

The vertigo is also in the right location - walking distance to china town, union sq and all the shops. Powell St/ Market St trams are also on the doorstep. Plenty of buses stop nearby to places like lands end, Ferry Building, Pier 39

review.title: Vertigo...just alright.

review.title: Thumbs up

There wasn't much about the hotel that reminded us of its namesake film, but the room was comfortable, clean, and the staff was helpful. The furniture and fixtures are kind of modern, but not annoyingly so. The location is great for walking around the city. Would totally stay there again.

Great location, extremely clean and comfortable. Definitely recommend! I do not however recommend booking through Expedia... Extremely dodgy and no value of customer service!!

Hotel vertigo is great though!!

review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Awesome for a weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Had a great experience at Hotel Vertigo. This quaint hotel has modern amenities, helpful, friendly staff, and is found in an excellent location. I highly recommend this hotel for people that are in San Francisco to explore the city and want a comfortable bed to sleep in.

review.title: Quaint but nice
review.reviewText:
If you are looking for a modern highrise hotel with all of the amenities that "hip" travelers demand these days, this may not be for you. My wife and I travel to San Francisco a few times a year and have stayed in many downton hotels. A perfect one-word description for this hotel is "quaint". From the moment you walk through the doors off the street, that word should jump to the front of your mind. They have the movie "Vertigo" playing on a flat screen continually behind the reception desk. The checkerboard marble floor looks very vintage. The coping and crown molding looks old, but cared for.

The room was small but very comfortable. I read a few comments about slow to no hot water. We were on the sixth floor and experienced none of that. The bed was comfortable, we had a nice TV and the internet worked as promised.

The front counter staff (Sam and Robert) were both very personable and helpful upon each visit.

The location was very convenient for us. It is right downtown and near enough transportation where we could get anywhere we needed to.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and it's locality to where we wanted to be.
review.locationRemarks: Good spot. Fairly easy with public transportation to get to the wharf or many spots downtown.

review.title: Okay room for a budget stay between area and money
review.reviewText:
We got a room overlooking neighbor's nice green backyard garden. However, the window can not be opened to let air in, so the room at times smells musty and humid (especially the bathroom). The room itself like other reviewers in tripadvisor had mentioned, only has cosmetic looks, it's not a bad look except you can tell it's using old materials to re-fitting the room.
The server forgot to clean the bathroom hence left no new towels. After we told the front desk, they efficiently changed it though.
Overall, the staffs are nice and it's a young, hip looking hotel. Only if the air is fresher...

review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: A little disappointed
review.reviewText: Room not ready on arrival as they had had a full-house the night before. No nice welcoming. Two of the three front of house staff were helpful but the other was miserable; no good customer service from this one! Disappointed that there was no restaurant or bar, however cleanliness of rooms were good. A bit out dated in corridors. Good location for Powell Street and city transportation. No hotel info in room - requires fire evacuation procedure and times of booking out etc. No "Goodbye," "Thanks" and "Hope to see you again" messge upon leaving. Good hearty breakfast can be found at Han's Cafe on the corner of the street - nice staff there.

review.negativeRemarks: No restaurant and bar; not all staff were welcoming, helpful and curteous. No info about the hotel & main attractions in room
