review.title: Not the best, but not the worst
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at Hotel Vertigo. The hotel has made nice renovations, however, most of the fixtures and furniture show wear. The attention to details is lacking as well, will knobs missing on the faucets, scratched wood visibly touched up with a black marker, and fingerprints on the walls- just to name a few. But I like the location (not in a tourist area) and the price, so I will probably stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, sleek lobby decor, and free wi-fi
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom- needed alot of upgrades. Was borderline dirty.
review.locationRemarks: Great neighborhood location- close to bus lines, downtown, not touristy

review.title: A very good value hotel.
review.reviewText:
This is a very nice, mid priced hotel.

It seeems to have been recently refurbished and my room was very clean and comfortable. The location is good if you intend to stay in central SF. It is about a 15 minute walk from the Powell Street BART (10 minutes going the other way due to the lay of the land). The BART will take you directly from SFO for about $8. Union Square, which is the shopping centre of the city, is equidistant more or less.

The area around the hotel does seem a bit low brow when you first turn up but it is better described as 'studenty'. It is certainly not at all threatening, even at night. It certainly compares well with a 5 block radius of Leicester Square if you want a comparison with London.

Most of the main attractions in SF are close enough to walk to if you can hack the hills. If not, there are good comms links nearby, especially on Market Street. (Powell Street BART is on a junction with Market Street). The Pier building is about 20 minutes away and Fisherman's Quay probably about 30 minutes if you feel the need to go there.

As for the hotel - I was very happy and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. It must be one of the best value hotels in that area with no compromises on service or comfort for the star band it's in. There is no restaurant. There are loads of exxcellent cafes within a stone's throw so a morning brew is no drama. I can't talk about parking as I was on foot.

Overall, very happy.
review.locationRemarks:
Good areas: Union Square for shopping and people watching. Same same for Union Street shops up by the Marina. The Piers for views of the Bay. Crissy Field and the Golden Gate Bridge are great areas and if you are up to it there are some great views on the western side of Fort Point, up on the hill above the Presidio. I also liked Alcatraz but that's me. The Art Museum tat the eastern edge of Crissy Field looks stunning.

Not so Good: Fisherman's Quay did nothing for me. The Maritime Museum is in this area though so that's a redeeeming feature if you like ships. I thought North Beach was a dump but again, personal preference. It's certainly pretty seedy at the edges.

Avoid: I would really avoid SOMA and even the western end of Market Street gets a bit dodgy at night.

Be aware that there is a huge homeless problem in SF and while most of them are too far gone to want to trouble anyone, they can be a little intimidating if you're a quiet type.

It's also worth mentioning that signage is not a strong point in the Presidio / Marina Area and that the roads up to the bridge are being rebuilt. It is probably better to walk / bike up from Crissy Fields along the Bay shore rather than through the centre of the Presidio. It's easier to navigate and the views are bettter.

I only passed through Chinatown on the way to North Beach so I can't comment. I also never got up to the Coit Tower but I am told it is a nice view point. I doubt it rivals the one on Alcatraz.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: good hotel , the worst tv channels , rare smell in the closed , very confortable room, you get what you pay
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Fishermans Wharf, golden gate

review.title: Very stylish hotel, but iffy location
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel service; the concierge was great! Only downside is that the hotel is in a slightly iffy location...

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: i loved this hotel

review.title: Great boutique hotel.
review.reviewText: Clean and tidy. This hotel is not full of all the mod cons but has everything you need at the right price. The staff were extremely helpful with a happy demeanor. No complaints at all. Shame its not closer to Fishermans Wharf but we walked it no problem. Would recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay around the Union square area.

review.title: Fabulous place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel Vertigo in San Francisco was a wondeful place to stay. It's in a great location in the city, not to mention all that's on the street (a market, restaurants, a cool bar, etc). The gentlemen at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful, especially Sean. They took the time to explain the layout of the city, travel, activities, etc. They didn't talk longer than necessary - gave only the info that was needed to make it a great trip. They were always very happy to answer any questions we had. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was spotless, and the room (and the hotel itself) was very stylish, but still very cozy and comfortable. Loved having a fridge in the room. The closet was huge. Nice flat screen TV and ipod dock for an alarm clock. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and I can't wait to go back.

review.title: Nice and Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText:
Fabulous customer service and I can tell you this hotel is a hidden jewel in downtown of SF. My hubby and I stayed 2 nights and I absolutely loved it.
They assigned me a renovated room on 4th floor.
Nice room size, comfortable bed and clean restroom.
Most of all, it was a perfect place to access many places.
Stay at Hotel Vertigo! You will love it!

review.title: Interesting area.
review.reviewText: Interesting area. Great old hotel.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: It's perfect, especially for the price. We paid extra for the renovated room and everything was new, clean and hip: from the mattress to the shower to the bath products. The staff was friendly and helpful & there's a great breakfast place right across the street.

review.title: Adequate Hotel...Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is old, but maintained well enough. The location was great...neighborhood seemed safe and peaceful. Great little cafe across the street for breakfast!

review.title: Not impressed...equilabrium at the Vertigo is paying more for your room at check-in.
review.reviewText: Stay somewhere else that is nicer for the same price.

review.title: So So
review.reviewText: The location was great for walking and the price was cheap. It's not a bad hotel but it's not a great hotel either. It's just so-so.

review.title: Great Hotel but Front Desk needs to be better at customer service
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because of location and the reviews. The place is nice, great location, Nob Hill and walking distance to almost everything. The hotel was the original location where the Alfred Hitchock movie was filmed which is interesting. The lobby is nicely decorated and they play the movie on loop. Things to note, there is no breakfast included just coffee in the lobby. That is okay beause there are plenty of places to eat in the area. I booked one of the traditional rooms, and while they are clean they are sort of dated looking and I wanted to change rooms. I asked numerous times to change, agreeing to pay the upgrade charge. The front desk told me the hotel was booked, even though on their reservation internet site it said there were rooms available. I was told by the front desk maybe I wanted to check their sister hotel. The next day I asked again and they hesitated to move me again stating it was full. I explained that there were rooms on-line and they said they had available rooms but had to leave them open for people checking in (that did not make sense). I kept checking and asking until finally the lady said "fine just give it to her." They ended up moving me after much negotiation and I do not understand why they could not do that the day before. The remodeled rooms are much nicer and worth the aggravation. I liked the hotel overall and will go back, and would recommend it to others. Also they are pet friendly which is nice.

review.title: Great Hotel- Not one Complaint!!!
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for the price! The room was amazing, even a bathrob!!! The location was perfect for walking San Fran! Awesome spot for a weekend get-a-way!

review.title: Buyer Beware
review.reviewText: The hotel is wonderful. The location is great with bars and restaurants near by, and downtown walking distance away. If only the front desk were as pleasurable. In fact, one attendant there managed to ruin the entire experience. She was very unprofessional, with no knowledge of any customer service skills whatsoever. It's unfortunate that one employee managed to make this trip as unpleasantly not only to me, but to other patrons who were there during their stay. Besides that, highly recommend it for the price.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo Review
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. They made us feel right at home. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Great Location!

review.title: Will definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Checking was really fast less than a minute. I thought the room was a good size. walking closet. It was very clean. I stayed there with my son and he loved it as well. I got a room facing the street. It was a bit loud at night but it was worth it. It really added to the whole San Francisco experience. The bed was very comfortable.There are great places to eat around the hotel - only walking distances (next door). I didn't have a problem with the location of the hotel. I thought it was just fine even at night. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Home away from Home
review.reviewText:
My son moved to San Francisco last summer. Every two months I come and stay
at the Hotel Vertigo for a long weekend. They always welcome me with" welcome
home."I love the hotel for its friendly staff and funky, functional decor.Its in a great location also.Can't wait to go home to the Vertigo!

review.title: It is a good choice only if you get a remodeled room.
review.reviewText:
Location is good. There are tons of restaurants and a nice coffee shop on the corner. Somewhat far away from BART station, but I didn't mind, since walking is good for you. However, choose your way carefully, better ask for directions at the hotel lobby.

The room was ugly. It was old. However, with Expedia discount, I was not paying a lot, so there is nothing really to complain. Towels were actually quite good, and it was the most enjoyable moment. Wall in this hotel are thin (this is true for every room), so any activity nearby will be heard by almost everyone around. It was quite annoying, since I was in town for business, and a good sleep was extremely valuable.

review.title: This place SUX
review.reviewText:
Horrible Hotel, on the edge of the worst part of San Francisco.
Emerson 19 inch TV from 1982, terrible terrible terrible.... Don't stay here trust me I own two restaurants and know the hospitality industry trust me don't do it

review.title: Great place to stay in the city
review.reviewText: Got an excellent rate. Renovated rooms are clean and modern. Nice comfy beds.

review.title: Good option.
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay. Nice and clean. No noyse and good personel support.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: I stayed at Hotel Vertigo whilst at a conference in downtown SF. The hotel location was convenient. The hotel has quite a cool feel to it. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. The bathrooms were particularly good for the price range of this hotel. All in all very good value for money.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo Excellent Place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Hotel Vertigo was a great place to stay, price was right, walking distance to Union Square-cable car, close to BART, hotel staff very welcoming and friendly. A must see is the play Beach Blanket Babylon-can ride the cable car to the play from Vertigo.

review.title: Great rooms and friendly, helpful staff.
review.reviewText:
The rooms were gorgeous, just like in the pictures. The staff was very, very friendly. They mapped out routes for us to take to help us find where we were headed and gave us directions over the phone to find the hotel. They even showed us a nearby parking garage we could use that was cheaper than their valet.
Even though we didn't request early check-in, we got into our room early. It was a really nice, very San Franciscan-looking hotel and I will likely stay there next time I'm in the area.

review.title: Great stay and cheap
review.reviewText: Great stay here and really cheap in this area. Though pretty old building without airconditioning, but the over all stay is good.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText:
I spent a week in San Francisco at the beginning of November - my first time visiting.

Although Hotel Vertigo had mostly good reviews from both Expedia and Trip Advisor, I still wasn't sure what to expect - the price seemed too good to be true. The hotel itself was exactly as pictured. I selected a renovated room. Looking at photos of the non-renovated rooms, I suspect that's what's pulled the overall star rating of the hotel down. Once renovations are complete, I wouldn't be surprised if prices go up.

My room was quiet and clean, and had everything I needed. The bed was particularly comfortable. The hotel was well maintained, with slightly eccentric décor, both in the rooms and in the lobby. While there's perhaps not the same impeccable attention to detail you'd see in a 4- or 5-star hotel, I had zero complaints.

The location is handy. The hotel is right on a bus route and is also a few blocks from the cable car line. (Transit in SF is great.)

The front desk staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and had great suggestions for everything I needed. In fact, all staff I encountered were cheerful and nice. In short, I'm not sure you could do better for the price. In fact, even if I'd paid more for my hotel, I still think this was a great pick.

In short, I was very happy with my stay and would recommend Hotel Vertigo without hesitation.

review.title: Quite good hotel but missed not having coffee/tea making in room.
review.reviewText: Overall satisfied.

review.title: would recommend only in the if it is not hot outside.
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice and helpful. NO AC on a humid day was not fun. only one window opens to cool things down. the room did cool down after about 40 min. Our bathroom was nothing like the picture which was what sold me when looking at pictures online. Nice location if you want to be off the busy streets but walking distance to fun sights.

review.title: What a gem!!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was just a great place to stay. The reception staff were very helpful in giving advice about the local area, tours and places to eat etc. Location was about a 5-10 minute walk from Union Square, which was fantastic. It is out of the way of the main CBD, but that was more of a positive than a negative.
The room was clean and maintained by the housekeepers on a daily basis. My absolutely favourite thing about the room was the bed. It was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever had slept in! The sheets and pillows were so soft that a good night's sleep was always a comforting thought at the end of the day. There was also a walk-in wardrobe in our room, which allowed us to put all of our luggage and clothes in the one spot, instead of having them spread out across the room. I loved the decor of the room and reception areas, very modern and quirky.
The only thing I would have preferred was to have tea & coffee available inside the room, rather than being served out in reception every morning. Other than that, I would definitely recommend this hotel for the price, location and quality of the room itself. I would come back to stay here again!!

review.title: Great Location...
review.reviewText:
away from crowds and tat of Union Square and surrounds (makes Leicester Square seem classy), but still within easy access of everything you need.
Make sure you get a refurbished 'Vertigo' room. Still two floors unrefurbished as at 10/2010. Clean, spacious rooms. Classy decor. Only complaint, no aircon. But only occasionally an issue in SF. No breakfast provided, so get out and sample some SF cafe culture, plenty of choice.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: I love this hotel, the room was charming and the staff was kind. great location in the city!

review.title: A very pleasant experience.
review.reviewText: We were looking for a hotel that was a place to change and sleep for an affordable price. This was an excellent choice. It was close to Union Square area with easy access to public transportation. The hotel was very easy to find and easy to get to on foot from the Union Square Bart station. Although we were several hours early the staff were very accomodating and stored our luggage so we could get out to see the city. Once checked in, we found the room to be very clean and welcoming and well maintained throughout our visit. The staff had excellent recommendations for restaurants and great suggestions for use of the public transportation system. They saved us a great deal of time when planning our days. Thank you to "all the staff" of the Vertigo for making our visit so pleasant.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo Excellent Value for Money
review.reviewText:
Hotel Vertigo is an older building currently being refurbished with modern fixtures and fittings, located on the border of the Tenderloin and Nob Hill Districts. The area was pretty quiet with plenty of cafes nearby for breakfast and about a ten-minute, four-block walk to Union Square. Staff were helpful and polite and the rooms spotlessly clean.

There are so many hotels to choose from in San Francisco, making a choice can take hours. If you want somewhere a bit different that's central, clean and doesn't cost a fortune, then look no further than the Hotel Vertigo.

review.title: Quite nice
review.reviewText:
Hotel and room were beautiful. They appear to be mid-remodel but most of the floors are done. The staff was very accommodating - they found me a room to check in to at 10:30am which is well before their normal check in time.
The hotel is a pretty short walk from the bart but the most direct route goes through a somewhat shady neighborhood. If you walk a couple of extra blocks it's not an issue.

review.title: Fun times in SF
review.reviewText: The place was super hip. It was way cooler than I thought it was going to be. Marble everywhere. Organic soaps in the bathroom. Great location.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, convenient location and we absolutely enjoyed our stay. Will definitely stay here again only if i have the chance to revisit San Francisco! Just love that city and Vertigo!

review.title: September 2010 Review
review.reviewText: This is a nice little hotel a short walk from Union Sq. The staff was friendly and were able to recommend a few nice spots for breakfast/dinner. The hotel was clean and modern. The only downsides were the old-fashioned, slow lift and the fact that the hotel could be little noisy in the evening.

review.title: Great little hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed here a few weeks ago. First trip to San Francisco, and we loved it! Staff was very friendly and helpful. It was extremely close to major bus lines, and there were some great little neighborhood shops right outside your door! The pizza and gelato places were great, and there were two grocery stores on the block. It is somewhat close to the Tenderloin district, so you might want to watch which direction you go at night! No problems at all near the hotel though. Internet was a little slow, but who wants to stay cooped up on the computer in a city full of things to do? No A/C in the room, but really most of the time you don't need it I think. It just so happened that we hit the city in their Indian summer, so the first few days were a bit warm. Still, the ceiling fan and open windows did the job just fine. We loved the hotel decor, very modern and interesting. Overall, very happy with the hotel and our stay there! We would go back.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Older, but well maintained hotel, within easy walking distance to Union Square and California Street cable car line. Was unsure of neighborhood the first night but soon learned it was safe enough to walk alone in the evening. Older vintage rooms in this hotel were very reasonably priced for the area. Hotel staff very accomodating.

review.title: Comfortable, friendly and reasonable
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my visit to Vertigo. It was comfortable and the staff helpful. It was disappointing there was no on sight place to eat meals.

review.title: Welcome to HELL
review.reviewText:
Worse experience ever, had a reservation for 2 twin beds and received 1 queen size bed. They admitted they screwed up and offer me a roll out bed since all the double bed rooms are booked. The roll out bed has the worse mattress ever, it was better to sleep on the floor. All in all, will never stay here and do not recommend this hotel. I could only connect to the free wifi at the lobby with my iphone. No connection in the bedroom and very low signal.

By the way I was not the only screwed up they had, I over heard 1 lady and 2 men reserved a twin bed and the same thing happen to them, when I was at the lobby using the wifi.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

review.title: Vertigo
review.reviewText: The bed was horribly hard and the room desperately needed to be remodeled. They are currently remodeling the whole hotel and I will come back again once they finish. The lobby is beautiful! The staff helped us to find free parking close by.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: We were very happy! The room was lovely and we were centrally located in the city. We'd stay again!

review.title: Great Hotes
review.reviewText: I'll keep this short, this hotel was great! Very reasonable for San Fran, clean, looked to be newly remodeled and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I will stay there again.

review.title: Sept 2010 Stay at Vertigo
review.reviewText: Vertigo is now our preferred mid-range hotel on Nob Hill. The neighborhood is very, very quiet, but close to everything. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the bathrooms lovely. We had a great time.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The receptionist was super nice and welcoming. She told us all he needed to know about San Francisco. The room was new, clean and beautiful. The LCD in the room was nice. Free Internet. Everything was excellent.

review.title: Amazing Vertigo!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. We were given a newly refurbished room, wich was always very clean, quiet and comfortable.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText:
no hot water
no signal of the mobile phone in the room

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, well renovated hotel

review.title: Great!!!
review.reviewText: Gorgeous hotel, friendly staff, funky decor. Good centre location to explore San Franscisco. I would highly reccomend!

review.title: Modern, hip, helpful
review.reviewText:
I sighed relief when I got a renovated room, as expected. The reservation said "deluxe" but wasn't definitively one of the newer rooms with the cool interior. When using the steps instead of the one small, old elevator, I saw the few lower floors yet un-renovated. They are drab and way outdated.
So the room was great, and the service was just as good. The front desk was always friendly and helpful to us, suggesting passes, shuttles and walking routes that would enhance our trip. If I continue to get good rates at this hotel via Expedia or another site, I'd never need to choose another hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
We chose Hotel Vertigo because (1) it was the least expensive 3-star hotel that we could find and (2) it had a better location than some of the others (we avoided others because of the reviews of how unsafe the neighborhoods were).

On check-in, they never actually said "hi." It took them about three minutes with us standing right at the desk before they even acknowledged we were there (apparently the computer system was down and they were a bit behind) -- and then the first words they said were: "Last name?". So they got the job done, but weren't terribly friendly. It got a little better over the next couple of days; they did their job, but it wasn't the "warmest" place.

We chose a non-renovated room for the lower rate, and it was just that. The twin beds were very, very, very firm. Outside our window was a huge white wall about 10 feet away, so we had no view and very little natural light in our room.

The room was old, but clean. It was also dark because the light bulbs weren't bright enough. Other than the hard beds and the crappy view, the room was fine. The shower was hot, and the tap-water tasted just fine.

Wireless internet was free, but a little slow. Valet parking was expensive--$35/day plus tax.

Since this was significantly cheaper than other hotels, I'm definitely not complaining -- just keepin' it real! If you're looking for an inexpensive stay in SFO, I'd recommend Vertigo. If you want more luxury, look elsewhere, or at least get one of the renovated rooms.

review.title: Great location, vary nice and helpful staff
review.reviewText:
Hotel Vertigo is not the most elegant from Frisco hotels, but it is clean, tidy and hotel employees are well trained, polite and helpful. It's a good value for the money. We were in the "old room" but I have heard that renovated ones are lovely.
I would recommend this hotel to all tourists with thinner wallets. If I'll be back in San Francisco I'll probably stay in the same place, but maybe in the renovated room...

review.title: Vivid and remarkable.
review.reviewText:
Upon arriving at the modest edifice, it's a sweet surprise that everything in the lobby is either gloss white rococo architectural detail, white marble, or lush, tangerine textiles. It's a clever concept that's smartly executed throughout the hotel. Neither Jonathan Adler-twee, or coldly modern, it's a bright, intelligent eclectic mix that feels just residential enough to be comfortable for people-watching, but stylish enough that it's winning and smile-inducing.

There is a smallish elevator, and an amazing, apropos staircase that extends to the top floors. The view down the staircase's inner well from a higher floor to the lobby is almost perfectly suited to the hotel's name.

The Vertigo is not at all stuffy or pretentious, and escapes the 'boutique hotel' template that the W has foisted off an on overpaying public. I stayed at the SF W during the same trip, and I much preferred the Vertigo, which was about one-third less expensive. The W is very stylish, but I find it overwhelming, even grating in its attempts to seduce.

The rooms are comfortable and stylish, with just the right amount of the signature orange elements; the leather club chair in each room is more the color of a burnt orange Coach bag. The beds are comfortable, and happily, the windows open.

The staff is helpful, but unobtrusive; there is neither the aggressive cult vibe of some upscale hotels, nor any sense of snobbishness in this Nob Hill location.

All in all, it's a little gem; I would happily return.

review.title: Walking distance to Union Square.
review.reviewText:
A block or two the wrong way can put you in a rather seedy area.
But we knew where we were headed and walked to both drinks, dinner and brunch the next morning with no concern.

review.title: Nice Experience at Hotel Vertigo
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and nicely furnished and is a convenient location. The BART station was about a 6 block walk. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Hotel was excellent. Everything as it looks in the pictures. The room was very spacious and clean. New, modern room. Although, from memory the room did not have an air con. However, San Fran doesnt not get that hot so we didnt really need one. Location was good - about a 5-10 min walk from Union Square.

review.title: Very comfortable, funky hotel
review.reviewText: At check in, we got a free room upgrade, and the room was very nice. The bed was comfy, free WiFi and big screen tv. There was also an iPod hookup in the room.

review.title: The Hotel Vertigo
review.reviewText: It was a

review.title: it's alright
review.reviewText: everything was pretty A. OK except they did not have a microwave. However, they had a fridge which didn't really make sense. The staff was courteous and there were no problems.

review.title: A hotel with a sense of style
review.reviewText: This is a very pleasant, centrally located hotel. The decor is clever; the staff friendly. My room was a good size with a very high tech bathroom and a small fridge, which was useful. There was a grocery, coffee shop and laundromat all on the same block as the hotel. A good value overall.

review.title: Great hotel at bargain price
review.reviewText:
- Great location
- Great room service with friendly staff
- Hotel seems to have been renovated recently so everything was new and in good condition - comfy beds, funky automatic lights, big screen TV, great bathroom

review.title: Fantastic staff, great location - clean room.
review.reviewText:
Fantastic staff-so polite & helpfull.
Great location-safe.
Good clean room, free Wifi in room,
1 computer & printer in the lobby,
We would def stay here again.

review.title: very cool
review.reviewText: We only stayed one night, and I am not a picky person, but I thought this hotel was great. The bed was fluffy and comfortable. The room and bathroom were very clean. I thought the hotel could have used more interesting decoration, but that's not the most important thing to me.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great place to stay. San Fran is a walking city so the location was perfect. Away from the touristy places but all that was close by. And the price was great. Loved it.

review.title: 2 Night Getaway
review.reviewText: hotel was nice and clean. enjoyed my stay!

review.title: Very convenient location, clean and nicely refurbished
review.reviewText: I primarily picked the Hotel Vertigo for its convenient location near Union Square with its shops, restaurants, bars and public transport and wasn't disapointed. Staff is friendly and helpful and the hotel is very well maintained. I recommand booking one of the refusrbished rooms, which are modern and quite funky. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a decent-price room in a central location.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: I took my mom to San Francisco for a short trip. We truly enjoyed the hotel. The rooms were spacious, cute and clean. It was perfect for the price. The only downside was there wasn't a bus station nearby (probably about five or six blocks) so you'll have to walk it or get a cab. We did both and didn't have a problem at all. Fairly good neighborhood and walking distance to Union Square. They are still renovating the lobby so I'm excited to see what it looks like when completed.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo can make you dizzy
review.reviewText: See above. I guess it is a matter of character. Either you are making a reservation for a certain room and bed size or you are not. And they don't agree with what you are reserving on line. So watch your back!

review.title: Really great hotel
review.reviewText: it was a very nice hotel. They remodeled it wonderfully. it's at a great location, you're just a few blocks away from Union Square, Chinatown and Japantown. I'll definitely come here again.

review.title: nice and easy
review.reviewText: the trip was great, we had no problem neither with the plane, nor with the hotel, no extra fees, no surprise, just as we expected it. and the staff was very welcoming.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo Non-Renovated Room
review.reviewText: We stayed in one of the non-renovated rooms. At check in, the front desk guy said we would be "upgraded" to a king size bed. This "king sized bed" was actually two twin beds pushed together, so it had a very hard ridge running down the middle. The next day, we said that we didn't want that "upgrade" and they changed our room with no problem. The second bed we had was a good one. And it was a real king mattress. Overall, the place was nice and the location was good. We could have used a fridge, but the price was great so we were happy. The non-renovated rooms are like a Days Inn room. No frills, but we're not very picky. The hotel is not in a bad neighborhood at all (really), but don't walk more then a couple blocks south/west at night into the Tenderloin (get a Frommer's guide book). We were worried going in that our 7 night stay wouldn't be comfortable in the non-renovated room, but if you are like us and are not picky, spend your money elsewhere in San Francisco. It was a great trip and we miss the beautiful city!

review.title: Boutique hotel in lower Knob Hill.
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a comfortable place to stay in San Francisco - this is it. The hotel is old, but well maintained and in a safe neighborhood. I've been a guest at this property on 4 occasions and I've found the service to be consistent each time. Many restaurants and bars are within walking distance as well as the Powell Street cable car.

review.title: Best hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel is wonderful! Staff is top-notch (the front desk staff ordered our Alcatraz tickets for us!), it was clean and everyone was wonderful. Not to mention the location is AWESOME! close to Union Sw(5-10 min walk) and a 5-min walk to the cable car

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: Best pillows I ever had. Is a very simple place to stay but quiet.affordable and clean ,even I saw dogs over there. You have your coffee in the morning,news paper of course I miss room service but is ok.

review.title: Base of Operations
review.reviewText: This is not a fancy hotel, but is comfortable, well staffed and is in an excellent location. We needed to deal with the Brazilian Consulate in the Finaicial District and were able to easily walk. We easily walked everywhere we wanted to go from the hotel. Great location and comfortable and will not break the bank.

review.title: Great Night
review.reviewText: Its a bit out of the way if you are walking, but the rooms have been renovated nicely and a great place to spend the night

review.title: Vertigo: Will Book Again
review.reviewText: The Hotel Vertigo was awesome. It was exactly as described, quiet, clean and stylish. I will be staying there again on my next trip to SF.

review.title: Could have been better
review.reviewText: Location OK close to buses, room small, fridge but no coffee/tea making facilities in room. Lift slow, no free internet. Wanted to extend check out to 5.00pm and would only do so if I paid for another night which was double what I had already paid.

review.title: Unique hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with lots of character. Room simple but clean and comfortable. Centrally located for downtown shops. Would recommend.

review.title: Reasonable price, reasonable accomodations-not high end
review.reviewText:
The non-updated rooms are truly non-updated. Stains on the carpet, broken lamp and not so comfortable bed or desk set up.
On the plus side, decent location (neighborhood a bit seedy), decent room size, free wi-fi, good size closet.
If you're an economy traveler this place works. If you're looking for something more special, go elsewhere.

review.title: What a wonderful time
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel which is only 7 blocks from Union Square with good public transport links. The hotel is with easy waliking distance to Chinatown and the shops around Union Square. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the renovated rooms were a pleasure to be in.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo....awesome!
review.reviewText: The Hotel Vertigo was a nice place to stay in San Francisco. I would recommend this place to others. It is close to the financial district which has a lot of shopping and food. Also, it is in a good locaiton to catch public transportation throughout the rest of the city.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: The Hotel Lobby was the nicest part of the hotel, The rooms were nothing like the picture I was looking at online

review.title: Location not so good, small rooms
review.reviewText: We found the location not so convenience as it was somehow little out of the middle of the center. After long day of walking in San Francisco it took us always some extra time going back to the hotel and specially if you wanted to go out for dinner again in the evening and walk back to the hotel. We booked a non renovated room which was ok even if the room was quiet small with view to a courtyard, luckily we only used the room for sleeping so for persons that spend more time in the hotel room I would not recommend this hotel. San Francisco is full of hotels and for the priced we paid I guess we could have found a better option.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The Hotel Vertigo is in a prime location for those looking to experience many different areas of San Francisco. Just blocks away from Union Square, we were easily able to walk to outstanding restaurants and shopping. There was also a good pizzeria two doors down. Pier 33 (Alcatraz Island) was a short $10 cab ride away too. All in all an excellent experience.

review.title: Beautiful rooms, great taste
review.reviewText: We love it, it's really well located and the decoration is brilliant. The only thing I didn't like is one small part of the lobby, where they have a TV set with the movie vertigo playing continuously and a big table completly out of place. If they can fix this corner it would be perfect.

review.title: great location and value
review.reviewText: for the price we paid a great value, room needs updates but apparently the hotel is in progress of that. our carpet was wet from i'm guessing getting cleaned, needed extra pillows, ....excellent location, very nice staff, my cell phone didnt work in my room..had to go to the lobby..i appreciated the coffee in the lobby in the mornings...i would stay here again

review.title: Hotel Vertigo
review.reviewText: Excellent refurbishment has given this hotel a luxury feel at a very reasonable price ( midweek on Expedia at least).Tastefully decorated with some unusual pieces of furniture (although the lobby was n't quite finished in May09).Pleasant and helpful reception. Complimentary coffee in the lobby. The film Vertigo is showing in the lobby. Not far to California-Van Ness cable car route.

review.title: Great value looking forward to redone room
review.reviewText: Staff good and good coffee smile

review.title: definite affordable option!
review.reviewText: hope the renovation gets completed soon, can't wait to go back and see the final product! great stay!

review.title: Worth the Money
review.reviewText: I stayed in an unrenovated room from Wednesday thru Saturday and it was definitely worth it. I can't wait to see the new rooms because my quaint simple room was pretty nice. Sure it wasn't luxury but I didn't pay for that. The room was simple, the bed was comfortable, the bedding was nice and comfy and the towels were clean and fluffy. If I had any say in the matter I'd suggest they make the wi-fi free since there aren't any amenities at the hotel and I'd also suggest they offer more than a coffee bar for two hours in the mornings. The downside was that in room 217 I couldn't get any cell phone reception as the room was in a corner facing a wall and vents. But hey the room was quiet.

review.title: Creative design
review.reviewText: I like the hotel personnels and their creativity. However, I felt like being ripped off with the condition of the bed. Instead of giving me a regular flatbed bed, they gave me a sofa bed. It wasn't that comfortable at all.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: A nice place for a very nice price I recomment this hotel to other as a good place to stay. Good confort and a very clean room.

review.title: Hotel Vertigo - Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We recently had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Vertigo in San Francisco. The décor in the hotel was amazing and I was very impressed. The service was typical of any hotel and not overly impressive. The staff gave the impression that they really did not want to be there. It was a little out of the way and the walk back up the hill from Union Square wasn't the nicest (all up hill). You can see they are still in the process of renovating the hotel(restaurant was still missing). Aesthetically it was one of the nicer hotels I stayed in during my trip.

review.title: Great hotel for a great price!
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for 11 nights on vacation and really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Vertigo and would recommend it to others. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The renovation of the hotel is not complete but we stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms and it was beautiful and very comfortable. The location is not great, it is on the edge of the Tenderloin which is not a great part of town, but that said, the hotel is close to lots of great restaurants and attractions. You can walk to Nob Hill in about 5 minutes and Union Station in about 5 minutes so you are not stuck in the Tenderloin.

review.title: Looking for a charming, yet affordable boutique hotel?
review.reviewText: Looking for a charming, yet affordable boutique hotel? We were trying to find a hotel in San Francisco that is located centrally, not a big chain, and affordable. Hotel Vertigo had it all! We got a reduced rate on the room, and it may get more expensive later. It helps that I'm a fan of the movie Vertigo. The entire hotel is well branded with the Vertigo theme and sleek modern furnishings. The one thing we didn't like was the bed. It had some protective layer on the mattress and it was very slippery to sleep on. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. They even had a luggage drop off service since our flight wasn't until late at night. We're from New York City, and we thought the neighborhood was just fine. For great Japanese food nearby, we recommend Sanraku, on 704 Sutter St.

review.title: SFBay - Trip
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, if staying be sure to get rooms in floor levels 4 and up as we upgraded from the second level as it was plain and wasn't the same room as on the website; thus upgrade!

review.title: Great hotel-stay here before the prices go up
review.reviewText: Overall a great place to stay. They are still remodeling in some parts of the hotel. Be sure to get a 'remodeled' room. The furnishings and bathroom were the best part, but the thin,old windows made the room cold and drafty at night. Be sure to use the heater.

review.title: So-So Accomodation
review.reviewText: When we arrived at the Vertigo hotel (with no storefront as they are still remodeling) we were notified that we had graciously been upgraded to a renovated queen room....however, we had PAID for a renovated KING room. No kings were available, so we had to make do with the queen room for the duration of our stay. No apologies or reimbursement was given for the mistake....we were however told that our room would come with plush terry cloth robes...oh boy!! Room was very small, much smaller than it appeared in pictures, but very clean. No A/C in the hotel, so if you go during the summer, you may get a little warm. All in all, it was a so-so hotel....glad we got such a good rate!

review.title: Renovation bargain
review.reviewText: This is obviously going to be a stunning boutique hotel when the renovations are finished; during my stay the lobby was under construction and only about half of the rooms had been finished. My (renovated) room was fantastic; designer decor, luxury bedding, plasma TV, high-end bathroom fixtures, and it was extremely quiet (my room faced the rear). I have no doubt that the room rates will be skyrocketing when it's complete; in the meantime if you don't mind a lobby that's a work-in-progress, you can have a real luxury hotel experience for the price of a motel room. Go!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the middle of being remodeled, but it is a nice hotel as long as you get a renovated room. We had some problems checking in, we paid for a renovated room and they tried to give us a non-renovated room so it took a lot longer to relax. Then once we got up to the room, it was really nice and clean it what the same as what the pictures showed. But one thing the beds are hard like a rock, it feels like you are sleeping on the floor. They should get new mattress.....
